common.dropOrClick: Drop file here or click to upload

login.error: The password you specified is wrong.

onboarding.welcomeHtml:
Let's start by creating your RPKI Certificate Authority (CA). It will be used to configure Delegated RPKI with one or multiple parent CAs, usually your Regional or National Internet Registry.

The handle you select is not published in the RPKI but used as identification to parent and child CAs you interact with. Please choose a handle that helps others recognise your organisation. Once set, the handle cannot be changed. Learn more...

addCAForm.format: This is not a valid CA name.

confirmation.title: Warning
confirmation.message: Once set, the handle cannot be changed. Continue?

cas.noCas: There are currently no Certificate Authorities defined.

confirmation.title: Warning
confirmation.message: This will remove the route authorization. Continue?
confirmation.retiredSuccess: The route authorization has been removed successfully.
confirmation.addedSuccess: The route authorization has been added successfully.

addROAForm.asn_format: This is not a valid ASN
addROAForm.prefix_format: Please enter a valid IPv4 or IPv6 prefix

caDetails.onboardingWarning: You will need to connect your CA to a public RPKI repository where it can publish your certificate and ROAs. As soon as the parent configuration is completed, relying party software will immediately start fetching your certificate and the ROAs you create from this repository.
caDetails.initialize: Please initialize the RPKI repository and/or the parent first.
caDetails.noResourcesYet: No resources have been fetched yet.
caDetails.copySuccess: XML correctly copied to your clipboard.

errors.pub-uri-no-slash: Publisher uri '{uri}' must have a trailing slash
errors.rfc8181-delta: File already exists for uri (use update!): {cause}
errors.ca-repo-response-invalid-xml: CA '{ca}' got invalid repository response xml: {cause}
errors.ca-repo-response-wrong-xml: CA '{ca}' got parent instead of repository response.
errors.ca-parent-duplicate: CA '{ca}' already has a parent named '{parent}'
errors.ca-parent-unknown: CA '{ca}' does not have parent named '{parent}'
errors.ca-parent-response-invalid-xml: CA '{ca}' got invalid parent response xml: {cause}
errors.ca-parent-response-wrong-xml: CA '{ca}' got repository response when adding parent.
errors.ca-parent-no-repo: Please configure the repository for CA '{ca}' before adding parents.
errors.ca-child-unknown: CA '{ca}' does not have child named '{child}'.
errors.ca-child-resources-required: Child '{child}' for CA '{ca}' MUST have resources specified.
errors.ca-child-unauthorised: CA '{ca}' does not know id certificate for child '{child}'.
errors.ca-auth-unknown: Cannot remove unknown authorization '{ca}' from CA '{prefix}-{max_length} => {asn}'
errors.ca-auth-invalid-max-length: Invalid max length in authorization: '{prefix}-{max_length} => {asn}' for CA '{ca}'
errors.ca-auth-not-entitled: Authorisation '{prefix}-{max_length} => {asn}' resource not held by CA '{ca}'
errors.key-no-new: No new key in resource class
errors.key-no-current: No current key in resource class
errors.key-no-old: No old key in resource class
errors.key-no-cert: No issued cert matching pub key
errors.key-no-match: No key found matching key identifier: {key_id}
errors.rc-resources: Mixed Address Families in configured resource set
errors.rc-missing-resources: Requester is not entitled to all requested resources.
